title: Display Firebase Images in React Native Card Swiper
description: Retrieve images from Firebase and show them in the card swiper of a React Native app.

steps.description: Review the React Native code and Firebase emulator setup for image retrieval.
Upload images to Firebase Storage and store their URLs in Firestore.
Query Firestore to get image URLs.
Debug Firestore queries in React Native to fetch images correctly.
Uninstall the web-based Firebase SDK; use only React Native Firebase.
Migrate your project to a new React Native setup that supports the card swiper and firebase sdk.
Now test querying the firestore from the new project
Store image URLs in state and map them to render each image on a card.

title: Upload Pictures to Firebase from React Native
description: Implement photo upload functionality in a React Native app to connect with Firebase.

steps.description: Create a form for selecting images using an image picker.
Configure Firebase Storage in your React Native app.
Write a function to upload selected images to Firebase Storage.
Handle upload progress and success/error states.
Display uploaded image URLs or confirmations in the app.

title: Create Card for Card Swiper Application
description: Design and implement a card component in a React Native application.

steps.description: Set up the React Native environment and run the app to preview the current card design.
Use styles to match the Canva design's colors and fonts.
Add mock data for multiple cards to test the card component functionality.
Test the card's responsiveness on different device sizes.
